doc.li: Randomly generated data about people and repository items.
The recommended Haplo RM Repository schema, based on Datacite and Dublin Core metadata standards.
Standard features for item upload, deposit review workflow, embargoes, REF and RIOXX monitoring, OAI-PMH integration.
Dashboards for overview of repository items and processes.
Click the "Repository" button on the right to see the menus.
Use the "Repository overview" directory to find a research output.
Follow the instructions below to impersonate other users.
As an academic the "My record" button second on the home pages links directly to pages about your use of the system.
From your profile you can add research outputs to the system. They will only be visible to authors and repository editors until they have gone through the deposit review workflow.
This process can be started from the output record.
When a workflow is in progress, it'll show who it's currently with on the right hand side. Impersonate the user to try the next step in the workflow.
To see the notification emails the system would send, click the user name in the top right, then "Test email viewer". (only available for repository administrator users)
doc.p: To see the system from the perspective of different roles, and to try out each step of a workflow, you can impersonate other users.
To try out the system as another user:
doc.li: Click the name of the current user in the top right of the screen
In the menu which appears, click "Impersonate user"
Choose a user from the list, or type to search.
Click the "Finish impersonation" button at the top of the screen to return to the original user, or choose a icon in the top left to quickly switch between users you've previously impersonated.
doc.p: Impersonation is only available to IT Support users in a live Haplo RM Repository system.
